content: Subzone of Queenstown Planning Area in Singapore **Commonwealth** is a subzone of [Queenstown](/wiki/Queenstown,_Singapore), located in the central-western part of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It is named after the [Commonwealth of Nations](/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Nations). Commonwealth consists of [Housing and Development Board](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) flats, and there is one primary school and a secondary school in the area, New Town Primary School and [Queensway Secondary School](/wiki/Queensway_Secondary_School). [SBS Transit](/wiki/SBS_Transit) Bus Services 32, 51, 93, 100, 105, 111, 122, 123, 145, 147, 153, 186, 195, 196, 198, [SMRT Buses](/wiki/SMRT_Buses) Services 61, 961/961M & 970 and [Tower Transit Singapore](/wiki/Tower_Transit_Singapore) Service 855 passes through this area. The nearest [Mass Rapid Transit](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) station is [Commonwealth MRT station](/wiki/Commonwealth_MRT_station). Amenities in the area include Blessed Sacrament Church, [Faith Methodist Church](/wiki/Faith_Methodist_Church), Masjid Mujahidin Mosque, Queenstown Community Centre, Queenstown Lutheran Church, Ridout Tea Garden, Shuang Long Shan Wu Shu Ancestral Hall, Sri Muneeswaran Temple and Tanglin Halt Food Centre and Market. ## Politics Commonwealth was once part of [Queenstown SMC](/wiki/Queenstown_Single_Member_Constituency) from 1955 to 1988 and subsequently became part of the founding constituencies of [Brickworks GRC](/wiki/Brickworks_Group_Representation_Constituency) in 1988 when it was first formed, prior to the [1988 General Election](/wiki/1988_Singapore_general_election). In 1997, this town became part of the expanded Buona Vista constituency as it was part of [Tanjong Pagar GRC](/wiki/Tanjong_Pagar_Group_Representation_Constituency) when both GRCs merged but Clementi, West Coast, Pasir Panjang and Telok Blangah were carved out to form [West Coast GRC](/wiki/West_Coast_Group_Representation_Constituency). In 2001, Commonwealth itself and the entire Buona Vista ward were being carved out to form [Holland-Bukit Panjang GRC](/wiki/Holland-Bukit_Panjang_Group_Representation_Constituency) and subsequently [Holland-Bukit Timah GRC](/wiki/Holland-Bukit_Timah_Group_Representation_Constituency) in 2006. Since then, Buona Vista (including Commonwealth) has since returned to Tanjong Pagar GRC in 2011 and this constituency is currently helmed by the incumbent [Minister for Education](/wiki/Ministry_of_Education_(Singapore)) [Chan Chun Sing](/wiki/Chan_Chun_Sing). Today, the entirety of Commonwealth (including Commonwealth Close and Crescent) is managed by Tanjong Pagar Town Council. - Singapore district This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Commonwealth, Singapore
